go_data.justification: Vav is a guanine nucleotide exchange factor for Rho GTPases.
Vav is involved in signaling pathways that mediate cell activation, such as the TCR-signaling cascade and collagen-induced activation of platelets.
Vav colocalizes with F-actin, Ena/VASP proteins, WASP, and the Arp2/3 complex at the lamellipodia of spreading platelets.
Vav is involved in the reorganization of the actin cytoskeleton in activated T cells and platelets.
Vav is part of a signaling pathway that links cell activation to the reorganization of the actin cytoskeleton.
